723326f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip
723326f-a.text:
South Strcet, west from Market Slip, showing the lower Manhattan Sky-
line, and a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge. The block of houses from Market
to Catherine Slips occupied by the Lawrence Son and Gerrish, bonded ware-
house, fseen in the extreme right foreground), have been demolished and its
site is now (1937) occupied by the New york American (a Hearst publication)
Building.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
723326f-a.folder: South Street & Market Slip, Manhattan, NY

723322f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip
723322f-a.text:
South Street, west from (No. 225), a point slightly east of Market
Slip, showing a general view of the immediate area and the ''skyscrapers'' of the
lower Manhattan financial district, as seen from the Manhattan Sridge. The
most prominent buildings shown (left to right),are; The Farmer's Loan and Trumt
Co.; the.wWell Street Tower, the Bank of Manhattan Co.; the Singer (with done);
the Woolworth and the lhuicipal Suildings. Also shown is a portion of the
Brooklyn Hridge and piers extending on the East River. Appearing in the fore-
ground is the Hearst Publications Building (white), occunving the north side
of South Street, between Market and Catherine Slipe. This set od three
views, more or less similar, were taken at the same time.
723322f-a.folder: South Street & Market Slip, Manhattan, NY

723323f-b.title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip (West).
723323f-b.text:
(1)
South Street, north side, west from Market Slip, showing (foreground)
the Hearst Publications 8uilding extending to Catherine Slip. Also shown
(background), is a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge, and (left to right), the
Farrmer's Loan and Trust Co., the 60 Wall Street Tower and the Bank of Man-
hattan Co. Buildings.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another view.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
723323f-b.folder: South Street & Market Slip (West)., Manhattan, NY

723327f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip
723327f-a.text:
South Street, north side, east from Market, to, but not including
Pike Slips. Also shown is Market Slip, east side, north from South
to Water Streets. Bridge shown, is the Manhattan.
October 14, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing a more extensive view, but excluding Market Slip.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

723328f-a.title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip
723328f-a.text:
232,233 and (the 1-story stable) 234-235 South Street, north side, be-
tween Market and Pike Slips (viewed eastward), showing the type of Marine mer-
chandise sold there.
March 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
